Class ThreadListFragment

java.lang.Object
  android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      ca.ualberta.cmput301w14t08.geochan.fragments.ThreadListFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, UpdateDialogListenerInterface
public class ThreadListFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements UpdateDialogListenerInterface

Responsible for the UI fragment that displays multiple ThreadComments to the user.

Author:
Henry Pabst, Artem Chikin

Method Summary
 void finishReload()
          Stores the retrieved ThreadComments in cache in case connection dies, applies the current sorting method to the newly retrieved ThreadComments, and refreshes the adapter so that they display properly.

          Checks if there is a network connection for pulling ThreadComments from ElasticSearch.

 void onStart()
          Initializes our fragment with various variables, displays the threads, sets up a onItemClickListener so the user is sent to the appropriate thread when they click on it, then sorts the threads according to the method the user has chosen.

onCreate

public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
Sets the fragment's adapter and starts a thread of execution to retrieve ThreadComments from ElasticSearch.

onResume

public void onResume()
Starts the location listener listening. If we're sorting threads by a user-entered location, locSortFlag will be set to 1, so we sort according to the specified location and set the flag back to 0.

Overrides:
onResume in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

onStart

public void onStart()
Initializes our fragment with various variables, displays the threads, sets up a onItemClickListener so the user is sent to the appropriate thread when they click on it, then sorts the threads according to the method the user has chosen.

Overrides:
onStart in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

onOptionsItemSelected

public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
Determines which sorting method was selected and calls the appropriate sorting method on our list of threads.

Overrides:
onOptionsItemSelected in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

reload

public void reload()
Starts a thread of execution to retrieve updated ThreadComments from ElasticSearch.

Specified by:
reload in interface UpdateDialogListenerInterface

finishReload

public void finishReload()
Stores the retrieved ThreadComments in cache in case connection dies, applies the current sorting method to the newly retrieved ThreadComments, and refreshes the adapter so that they display properly.
